body:
Hello @jdoepfert! Thanks for updating the PR.

 - In the file [`pandas/core/algorithms.py`](https://github.com/pandas-dev/pandas/blob/80d9c3d34102025dd082ab07cb38ba5dca3821c4/pandas/core/algorithms.py), following are the PEP8 issues :

> [Line 419:13](https://github.com/pandas-dev/pandas/blob/80d9c3d34102025dd082ab07cb38ba5dca3821c4/pandas/core/algorithms.py#L419): [E265](https://duckduckgo.com/?q=pep8%20E265) block comment should start with '# '

> Powered by [Codecov](https://codecov.io/gh/pandas-dev/pandas/pull/19508?src=pr&el=footer). Last update [f6b260b...80d9c3d](https://codecov.io/gh/pandas-dev/pandas/pull/19508?src=pr&el=lastupdated). Read the [comment docs](https://docs.codecov.io/docs/pull-request-comments).

@jreback Added a description. Agree, this definitely needs a performance check, will work on that tomorrow

EDIT: can't run asv at the moment, see #19518

Still not sure I got it. Tried to implement the set check approach, but due to this test (L502 in `test_algos.py`)
```python
    def test_i8(self):

        arr = pd.date_range('20130101', periods=3).values
        result = algos.isin(arr, [arr[0]])
        expected = np.array([True, False, False])
```
I still had to to some datetime-like type checking:
Here, the dtype of `comps` is initially `datetime64[ns]`, but ensure_data makes it `int64` (`<M8[ns]`).  The dtype of the items in `values` is different, so no conversion is enforced. 
Hence I do not only check for exact equality of the dtypes (that ensure_data and the set check return) but I additionally use `is_time_like()`. 

Some tests are still failing, but if that's the way to go, I'll fix this up

Won't have time to work on this for the next 2 months, so if anyone wants to take over, give it a go! The last commit with all tests passing was https://github.com/pandas-dev/pandas/pull/19508/commits/cd14c56f5b3f8415e36b20934e8a011a462603d4.
